response.name: Buffalo Chicken Sticks:
instructions: 1. Preheat a large skillet or saucepan filled with oil to 350°F.
2. In a bowl, combine the flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
3. In another bowl, whisk together the milk and hot sauce.
4. Dip the chicken strips into the flour mixture, then into the milk mixture, and back into the flour mixture.
5. Fry the chicken strips in the hot oil until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes.
6. Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery sticks.

response.name: Chipotle Chicken Cups
ingredients: 1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. In a large bowl, mix together ground chicken, chipotle pepper, onion, cilantro, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Place wonton wrappers in a muffin tin.
4. Spoon chicken mixture into wonton wrappers.
5. Drizzle olive oil over chicken cups.
6. Bake for 20 minutes.
7. Serve and enjoy!

response.name: Buffalo Chicken Dip:
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, mix together all ingredients until well combined.
3. Spread mixture into an 8x8 inch baking dish.
4. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
5. Serve with chips, celery, or carrot sticks.

{'ingredient': 'cheese'}.response: {'name': 'Baked Brie with Fig Jam', 'ingredients': ['-1 wheel of brie', '-1 jar of fig jam', '-1 package of puff pastry', '-1 egg'], 'instructions': ['1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.', '2. Cut puff pastry into small squares.', '3. Place brie wheel in the center of each square.', '4. Top with fig jam.', '5. Wrap pastry around brie and brush with beaten egg.', '6. Bake for 15-20 minutes.', '7. Enjoy!']}

response.name: BLT Bites
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
2. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove from the skillet with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
3. In a medium bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, and black pepper.
4. Fill each phyllo shell with a dollop of the mayonnaise mixture and a piece of bacon.
5. Place the shells on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, or until the phyllo is crispy.

{'ingredient': 'shrimp'}.response: {'name': 'Shrimp Cocktail', 'ingredients': ['-1 lb. cooked shrimp', '-1/2 cup ketchup', '-1/4 cup prepared horseradish', '-1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', '-1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '-Dash of hot pepper sauce'], 'instructions': ['1. In a medium bowl, combine ketchup, horseradish, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce.', '2. Add cooked shrimp and toss to coat.', '3. Serve chilled with cocktail sauce.']}

response.name: Vegetable Pakoras
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, whisk together gram flour, baking powder, cayenne pepper, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper.
2. Add water and olive oil, and mix until well combined.
3. Add onion, carrot, potato, green peas, cilantro leaves, and lemon juice, and mix until all ingredients are well coated with the batter.
4. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
5. Scoop heaping tablespoons of the batter into the hot oil, and fry for 3-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
6. Drain on paper towels, and serve hot with your favourite dipping sauce.

{'ingredient': 'avocado'}.response: {'name': 'Stuffed Avocado Bites', 'ingredients': ['4 ripe avocados, halved and pitted', '1/2 cup prepared salsa', '1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro'], 'instructions': ['1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', '2. In a medium bowl, combine salsa, cheese, and cilantro.', '3. Spoon mixture into the avocado halves.', '4. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.', '5. Serve warm.']}
